speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first started noticing this rash on your scalp and forehead? Was it sudden or did it develop over time?

speaker: Patient
text: It started a few weeks ago, I think. At first, I had a few red spots, and they gradually got worse, flaking off and leaving a bit of a greasy residue.

speaker: Doctor
text: When did you first notice the rash was it a one-time incident or did it keep reappearing over the years?

speaker: Patient
text: It kept coming back, actually. It would appear, get worse, and then subside, only to come back again a few days later.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the rash itself - is it itchy, red, blistering, or does it appear as a patchy area?

speaker: Patient
text: It's more like a scaly, flaky texture, especially when it's on my forehead. It's not super itchy, but sometimes I'll scratch it and it might feel a bit tender.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to perform a visual examination to better assess the rash. Can you please lift your head slightly so I can take a closer look?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm trying my best to be still, but I'm a bit uncomfortable with you looking at me right now.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the rash on your forehead? Is it confined to that area, or has it spread to other parts of your face or body?

speaker: Patient
text: It's mostly on my forehead, but sometimes it spreads down to my scalp and up to the sides of my face. It's like it's trying to cover the whole area, but it doesn't seem to be spreading very far.

speaker: Doctor
text:
How long have you been experiencing this rash, and did you notice any triggers or patterns, such as exposure to certain weather conditions or stress?



Can you tell me more about the rash itself - is it itchy, red, blistering, or does it appear as a patchy area?



Can you point to the exact area on your forehead where the rash is located, and is it symmetrical or does it seem to be more concentrated on one side?



Please remain still for just a moment so I can take a closer look at the rash on your scalp and forehead.

speaker: Patient
text:
I think it started when the weather got colder. It seems to get worse during those times.

The rash on my forehead feels scaly, and it's more noticeable when I'm feeling stressed or uncomfortable.

This spot *points to the forehead*, and it's a bit more concentrated on one side, but it doesn't seem to be uneven.

*stays still*

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about the rash itself - is it itchy, red, blistering, or does it appear as a patchy area?



Also, I'd like to examine the rash more closely. Can you please gently move your scalp and forehead to the left and right, so I can see how the rash spreads across these areas?



And, can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in the rash over time, such as its size, color, or texture?



Please hold still, I need to take a closer look at the rash.

speaker: Patient
text: It's a bit itchy, but not too bad. When I scratch it, it might feel a bit tender, but it's not too painful.

speaker: Doctor
text:
I've been observing the rash on your scalp and forehead for about 3 months now. It started as a small patch of redness on my forehead, and over time, it has spread to my scalp, forming a patchy area. 

 REQUEST TEST: Scalp_Biopsy

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask a few more questions before we proceed with the test. Can you tell me if the rash is more sensitive to temperature changes, such as cold or heat, and if it seems to be more pronounced during certain times of the day?

speaker: Patient
text: I think it gets a bit worse when the temperature drops, like when it's really cold outside. And it seems to be more noticeable in the morning, I guess, when I wake up.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me if you've experienced any other symptoms besides the rash, such as fever, fatigue, or joint pain?



Also, can you describe the sensation of the rash - is it tender to the touch, or does it feel more like a burning sensation?



And, have you noticed any changes in your hair growth or scalp texture, such as thinning or dryness?

speaker: Patient
text:
Actually, I do have some other symptoms, like being more uncomfortable when the weather gets really cold, and sometimes I feel a bit tired after playing with my toys. 

The rash feels kind of tender to the touch, but not extremely painful, like if you press really hard on it.

I haven't noticed anything weird with my hair or scalp, but sometimes it feels a bit greasier than usual.

speaker: Doctor
text:
I'd like to examine the rash more closely, so I'd like to gently press on the affected area with my fingers. Can you hold still for a moment?

Also, I'd like to ask, have you noticed any changes in your skin sensitivity or reaction to skincare products or sun exposure?

speaker: Patient
text:
It might hurt a bit, but I'll try my best to hold still.

I don't really notice anything different with the way my skin reacts to skincare products or the sun. I just use whatever my mom gives me to keep my skin clean and moisturized.

And, yeah, it can be a bit uncomfortable when you press on the rash, but it's not too bad. It's like it's just a bit... irritated.

I think the rash might be a bit more sensitive to cold temperatures, like when it's really chilly outside. It seems to get a bit worse then.

I've also noticed that the rash seems to get a bit worse when I'm feeling really tired or uncomfortable, like when I'm playing outside for a long time or getting too hot.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm going to take a closer look at the rash on your scalp and forehead again. From what I can see, it seems to be a patchy area of redness, but I'm not seeing any blisters or extreme tenderness. Can you tell me more about your hair growth in this area? Have you noticed any changes in thickness, dryness, or breakage?

speaker: Patient
text: It's gotten a bit drier and flakier, especially when it's on my forehead. I don't really notice any changes in thickness, but sometimes it feels a bit brittle.

speaker: Doctor

speaker: Patient
text: I don't really have a daily routine, I just play with my toys and cry sometimes. My mom washes my hair with a special shampoo and sometimes it gets dry and flaky, but that's not really related to the rash.
